task.title: Comparing current version with standard model version

context.p: After you have created a configuration project, you can compare a model's current configured version to the standard version.
Your configuration project corresponds to a branch in your source management system (e.g., Subversion (SVN)). This branch is based on the standard project. If you use SVN, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Right-click on the model in the DS Navigator view pane.
Click First revision together in the show history view. The first revision corresponds to the delivered standard model.
Right-click and select Compare current with NUMBER where the NUMBER corresponds to your configured model version.
step.stepresult: The compare editor is opened and shows the differences between the standard and configured models.
